result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
11:27 AM Cases 22CF180 and 22TR550 called together.  Defendant Jeorge A Sales appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal appeared by video for Jeorge A Sales.  Prosecuting attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Def appearing from Douglas County jail.  Case set for preliminary hearing.  Atty Rosenthal indicates def is waiving prelim; Court releases the witnesses.  Case proceeds to Waiver of Preliminary Hearing: Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State files information mirroring complaint.  Case proceeds to Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Bond continues.
Status conference scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status conference on November 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Waiver of personal appearance

WTLPH.  Def believes Joseph Rosenthal is going to be appointed.  Def sitting 90 day probation sanction; def approved for Zoom appearance for adjourned prelim.

Attorney Michelle M Erdman appeared by video for Jeorge A Sales.  Cases set for preliminary hearing, but def is waiving.  Off the record 10:20 AM.  Back on the record 10:23 AM, same appearances as previously noted.  Discussion as to whether or not this is proceeding today.  Def makes statements.  Court asks Atty Erdman if she wants to be removed from case; Atty Erdman believes that's in the def's best interest.  Atty Erdman is removed from case; will need another PD appointed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.
